actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on May 10, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Wilson (SC) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in rememberance of the victims of the recent shooting in Allen, Texas.
On approving the Journal Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 356
actions-list.actionItem: 50 (Roll no. 204).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1715 — "To direct the Department of Energy and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to conduct collaborative research in order to advance numerical weather and climate prediction in the United States, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 351
actions-list.actionItem: 58 (Roll no. 203).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 676 — "To amend the Federal Ocean Acidification Research And Monitoring Act of 2009 to require the Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, to collaborate with State and local governments and Indian Tribes on vulnerability assessments related to ocean acidification, research planning, and similar activities, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 676, H.R. 1715, and agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess for a period of less than 15 minutes.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1734.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Miller (OH) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1734 — "To require coordinated National Institute of Standards and Technology science and research activities regarding illicit drugs containing xylazine, novel synthetic opioids, and other substances of concern, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1715.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Miller (OH) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1715 — "To direct the Department of Energy and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to conduct collaborative research in order to advance numerical weather and climate prediction in the United States, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 676.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Miller (OH) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 676 — "To amend the Federal Ocean Acidification Research And Monitoring Act of 2009 to require the Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Administrator of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, to collaborate with State and local governments and Indian Tribes on vulnerability assessments related to ocean acidification, research planning, and similar activities, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Rosendale to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Mr. Rosendale demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Rosendale objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
